raw_json.html_title: Delete a List Component in R | R-bloggers
raw_json.main_html:
Delete a List Component in R

Posted on June 24, 2009 by Yu-Sung Su in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on Yu-Sung Su's Blog, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

In R, the way to delete a component in a list object is different from matrix and vector objects. For a vector, to delete an element:vec <- c(1, 2, 3)vec <- vec[-3]For a matrix, to delete a row or a column:mat <- matrix(c(1,2,3,4), 2, 2)mat2 <- mat[-1,] # delete a rowmat3 <- mat[,-1] # delete a columnFor a list, to delete a component:lis <- vector("list", 3)lis[[3]] <- NULLJust assign a NULL

Related

To leave a comment for the author, please follow the link and comment on their blog: Yu-Sung Su's Blog.
